verses.text: The words of Agur the son of Jakeh, \add even\add* the prophecy: the man spoke to Ithiel, even to Ithiel and Ucal,
Surely I \add am\add* more brutish than \add any\add* man, and have not the understanding of a man.
I neither learned wisdom, nor have the knowledge of the holy.

Who hath ascended into heaven, or descended? who hath gathered the wind in his fists? who hath bound the waters in a garment? who hath established all the ends of the earth? what \add is\add* his name, and what \add is\add* his son's name, if thou canst tell?
Every word of God \add is\add* pure: he \add is\add* a shield to them that put their trust in him.
Add thou not to his words, lest he reprove thee, and thou be found a liar.
Two \add things\add* have I required of thee; deny \add them\add* not to me before I die:
Remove far from me vanity and lies; give me neither poverty nor riches; feed me with food convenient for me:
Lest I be full, and deny \add thee\add* , and say, Who \add is\add* the LORD? or lest I be poor, and steal, and take the name of my God \add in vain\add* .
Accuse not a servant to his master, lest he curse thee, and thou be found guilty.
\add There is\add* a generation \add that\add* curseth their father, and doth not bless their mother.
\add There is\add* a generation \add that are\add* pure in their own eyes, and \add yet\add* are not washed from their filthiness.
\add There is\add* a generation, O how lofty are their eyes! and their eyelids are lifted up.
\add There is\add* a generation, whose teeth \add are as\add* swords, and their jaw-teeth \add as\add* knives, to devour the poor from off the earth, and the needy from \add among\add* men.
The horse-leech hath two daughters, \add crying\add* , Give, give. There are three \add things that\add* are never satisfied, \add yes\add* , four \add things\add* say not, \add It is\add* enough:
The grave; and the barren womb; the earth \add that\add* is not filled with water; and the fire \add that\add* saith not, \add It is\add* enough.
The eye \add that\add* mocketh at \add its\add* father, and despiseth to obey \add its\add* mother, the ravens of the valley shall pick it out, and the young eagles shall eat it.
There are three \add things which\add* are too wonderful for me, yes, four which I know not:
The way of an eagle in the air; the way of a serpent upon a rock; the way of a ship in the midst of the sea; and the way of a man with a maid.
Such \add is\add* the way of an adulterous woman; she eateth, and wipeth her mouth, and saith, I have done no wickedness.
For three \add things\add* the earth is disquieted, and for four \add which\add* it cannot bear:
For a servant when he reigneth; and a fool when he is filled with food.
For an odious \add woman\add* when she is married; and a handmaid that is heir to her mistress.
There are four \add things which are\add* little upon the earth, but they \add are\add* very wise:
The ants \add are\add* a people not strong, yet they prepare their food in the summer;
The conies \add are but\add* a feeble people, yet they make their houses in the rocks;
The locusts have no king, yet go they forth all of them by bands;
The spider taketh hold with her hands, and is in king's palaces.
There are three \add things\add* which go well, yes, four are comely in going:
A lion, \add which is\add* strongest among beasts, and turneth not away for any;
A greyhound; a he-goat also; and a king, against whom \add there is\add* no rising up.
If thou hast done foolishly in lifting up thyself, or if thou hast thought evil, \add lay\add* thy hand upon thy mouth.
Surely the churning of milk bringeth forth butter, and the wringing of the nose bringeth forth blood: so the forcing of wrath bringeth forth strife.
